intro: [WRONG START] Aquinum, commonly known as the common tansy, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its feathery, aromatic leaves and yellow-orange composite flowers. The plant is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in meadows and along roadsides. Anguinum contains compounds such as thujone, which have been historically used in herbal medicine. However, it is toxic in large quantities and should be handled with care.
